paper_abstract: A hounded language L subset of x(1)* ... x(k)* (for some k >= 1 and not-necessarily distinct nonempty words x(1), ... , x(k)) is bounded semilinear if the set Q(L) - {(i(1), ..., i(k)) vertical bar x(1)(i1) ... x(k)(ik) is an element of L} is semilinear, We give characterizations of bounded semilinear languages in terms of one-way and two-way deterministic counter machines.
paper_title: CHARACTERIZATIONS OF BOUNDED SEMILINEAR LANGUAGES BY ONE-WAY AND TWO-WAY DETERMINISTIC MACHINES
